docs.title: Step 2.1: Create Conversation API
docs.text:
File: server/routes/conversations.ts (new or update existing)

import { Router } from 'express';
import { db } from '../db/index.js';
import { conversationMessages, projects } from '../db/schema.js';
import { eq, desc } from 'drizzle-orm';

const router = Router();

// GET /api/projects/:id/conversation
router.get('/:projectId/conversation', async (req, res) => {
    try {
        const { projectId } = req.params;

        if (!req.user) {
            return res.status(401).json({ error: 'Unauthorized' });
        }

        // Verify access
        const project = await db.query.projects.findFirst({
            where: eq(projects.id, projectId)
        });

        if (!project || project.userId !== req.user.id) {
            return res.status(403).json({ error: 'Access denied' });
        }

        // Get conversation history
        const messages = await db.query.conversationMessages.findMany({
            where: eq(conversationMessages.projectId, projectId),
            orderBy: [conversationMessages.createdAt]
        });

        return res.json({ messages });
    } catch (error) {
        console.error('Failed to fetch conversation:', error);
        return res.status(500).json({ error: 'Failed to fetch conversation' });
    }
});

// POST /api/projects/:id/conversation
router.post('/:projectId/conversation', async (req, res) => {
    try {
        const { projectId } = req.params;
        const { type, content, versionNumber, status } = req.body;

        if (!req.user) {
            return res.status(401).json({ error: 'Unauthorized' });
        }

        const [message] = await db.insert(conversationMessages).values({
            projectId,
            type,
            content,
            versionNumber,
            status: status || 'success'
        }).returning();

        return res.json({ message });
    } catch (error) {
        console.error('Failed to add message:', error);
        return res.status(500).json({ error: 'Failed to add message' });
    }
});

export default router;

export function Project() {
    const { id } = useParams();
    const [prompt, setPrompt] = useState('');
    const [conversationHistory, setConversationHistory] = useState<ConversationMessage[]>([]);

    // Fetch project with conversation
    const { data: project, refetch } = useQuery({
        queryKey: ['project', id],
        queryFn: async () => {
            const res = await axios.get(`${API_URL}/api/projects/${id}`);
            setConversationHistory(res.data.conversationMessages || []);
            return res.data;
        }
    });

    // Enhancement mutation
    const enhanceMutation = useMutation({
        mutationFn: async (enhancementPrompt: string) => {
            return axios.post(`${API_URL}/api/generate/enhance`, {
                projectId: id,
                currentCode: project.currentCode,
                enhancementPrompt
            });
        },
        onSuccess: (data) => {
            // Update conversation
            setConversationHistory(prev => [
                ...prev,
                {
                    id: Date.now().toString(),
                    type: 'user',
                    content: prompt,
                    timestamp: new Date(),
                    status: 'success'
                },
                {
                    id: (Date.now() + 1).toString(),
                    type: 'ai',
                    content: `Enhanced to version ${data.data.versionNumber}`,
                    versionNumber: data.data.versionNumber,
                    timestamp: new Date(),
                    status: 'success'
                }
            ]);

            // Refresh project
            refetch();
            setPrompt('');
        }
    });

    return (
        <div className="container mx-auto p-6">
            <div className="grid lg:grid-cols-2 gap-6">
                {/* Left Column */}
                <div className="space-y-6">
                    {/* Conversation History */}
                    <ConversationHistory
                        messages={conversationHistory}
                        onSelectVersion={(versionNumber) => {
                            // Load that version
                        }}
                    />

                    {/* Enhancement Panel */}
                    <Card>
                        <CardHeader>
                            <CardTitle>Enhance Prototype</CardTitle>
                        </CardHeader>
                        <CardContent>
                            <Textarea
                                value={prompt}
                                onChange={(e) => setPrompt(e.target.value)}
                                placeholder="Describe improvements..."
                                rows={4}
                            />
                            <Button
                                onClick={() => enhanceMutation.mutate(prompt)}
                                disabled={!prompt.trim() || enhanceMutation.isPending}
                                className="w-full mt-4"
                            >
                                {enhanceMutation.isPending ? 'Enhancing...' : 'Enhance'}
                            </Button>
                        </CardContent>
                    </Card>
                </div>

                {/* Right Column */}
                <div>
                    {/* Preview */}
                    <PrototypePreviewer
                        code={project?.currentCode || ''}
                        versionNumber={project?.currentVersion || 0}
                    />
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
    );
}

const handleCodeUpdated = (newCode: string, versionNumber: number) => {
  // Update local state
  setCode(newCode);

  // Refresh prototype data

  // Optional: Switch to preview tab

    title: `Version ${versionNumber} created`,
    description: 'Prototype enhanced successfully'
  });

docs.title: Advanced Features for MDAs & Development Bank of Nigeria
docs.text: This document outlines specialized features for LocalBridge tailored to the unique requirements of Ministries, Departments, and Agencies (MDAs) and the Development Bank of Nigeria (DBN). These features prioritize Data Sovereignty, Compliance, Digitization, and Financial Inclusion.

docs.title: 1. "Sovereign Form-to-App" Wizard
docs.text: Goal: Accelerate the transition from paper-based bureaucracy to digital services. * Functionality: * Input: Upload scanned PDFs or images of existing physical government forms (e.g., Visa applications, Land Registry forms). * AI Process: Local AI analyzes the form structure, identifies fields, validation rules, and required signatures. * Output: automatically generates a secure, responsive React Web App with a PosegreSQL schema and API endpoints to capture this data. * Compliance: Auto-embeds NDPR (Nigeria Data Protection Regulation) consent checkboxes and privacy notices.

docs.title: 2. Multi-Language "Wazobia" Interface Generator
docs.text: Goal: Enhance citizen accessibility across Nigeria's diverse linguistic landscape. * Functionality: * Local Localization: One-click generation of UI variants in Hausa, Yoruba, Igbo, and Pidgin English. * Voice-First UI: Auto-generate interfaces that support voice input/output for citizens with lower literacy levels, using localized speech-to-text models.

docs.title: 3. GovStack Interoperability Layer
docs.text: Goal: Ensure seamless data exchange between agencies (e.g., NIMC <-> FIRS). * Functionality: * Ne-GIF Compliance: AI enforces code generation patterns that align with the Nigeria e-Government Interoperability Framework (Ne-GIF). * NIN Integration Component: Pre-built, secure components for validating National Identity Numbers (NIN) without storing sensitive data locally, connecting directly to NIMC gateways.

docs.title: 4. "Galaxy Backbone" One-Click Deploy
docs.text: Goal: Simplify hosting within national infrastructure. * Functionality: * Deployment scripts and Docker configurations pre-optimized for Galaxy Backbone infrastructure (the government's shared services provider). * Ensures applications are "Data Sovereign" by default, preventing sensitive government data from hosting on foreign clouds (AWS/Azure) unless explicitly configured.

docs.title: 🏦 Features for Development Bank of Nigeria (DBN)
5. SME Credit Scoring & Risk Modeling Workbench
docs.text: Goal: Expand credit access to MSMEs with limited credit history. * Functionality: * Alternative Data Pipelines: Prototyping tools to quickly connect APIs from Telcos (airtime usage), Utility Boards, and eCommerce platforms to build alternative credit scoring models. * Risk Dashboard Generator: AI-generated internal dashboards for visualizing PFI (Participating Financial Institutions) portfolio performance and non-performing loan (NPL) risks.

docs.title: 6. Automated Regulatory Reporting Agents
docs.text: Goal: Streamline compliance with Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) regulations. * Functionality: * CBN Report Bot: An AI agent capable of querying internal databases to auto-generate standard CBN returns (e.g., e-FASS reports). * Audit Trail Enforcer: Automatically injects immutable audit logging into every generated financial transaction component, ensuring 100% traceability for auditors.

docs.title: 7. "Bank-in-a-Box" for Microfinance Partners
docs.text: Goal: Empower smaller MFBs (Microfinance Banks) to digitize key operations. * Functionality: * White-Label Portal Generator: DBN can generate and distribute standardized, secure loan application portals to its partner MFBs. * Function: Allows MFBs to digitally capture SME loan requests and forward eligible ones to DBN seamlessly.

docs.title: 8. Air-Gapped "Redacted" Mode
docs.text: Use Case: Defense & Intelligence Agencies. * Functionality: A version of LocalBridge that runs 100% offline with zero internet access, allowing developers to prototype top-secret applications using strictly local LLMs (e.g., Llama 3 on-device).

docs.title: 9. Procurement Integrity Blockchain
docs.text: Use Case: Reducing corruption in public contracting. * Functionality: A prototype module that hashes procurement bids/records to a permissioned blockchain (or immutable ledger) at the moment of submission, guaranteeing that bids cannot be altered retroactively.

docs.title: 10. National Single Sign-On (SSO) Adapter
docs.text: Use Case: Unified Government Access. * Functionality: Pre-built authentication components that integrate with a future Nigerian National SSO, allowing citizens to use one login for Passport, Drivers License, and Tax services.

const [projectToDelete, setProjectToDelete] = useState<Project | null>(null);

docs.title: Mutation Added
docs.text:
const deleteMutation = useMutation({
    mutationFn: async (projectId: string) => {
        const token = localStorage.getItem('auth_token');
        await axios.delete(`${API_URL}/api/projects/${projectId}`, {
            headers: { Authorization: `Bearer ${token}` }
        });
    },
    onSuccess: () => {
        queryClient.invalidateQueries({ queryKey: ['projects', currentOrg?.id] });
        setDeleteProjectId(null);
        setProjectToDelete(null);
        toast({ 
            title: 'Project deleted',
            description: 'The project and all its prototypes have been permanently deleted.'
        });
    },
    onError: (error: any) => {
        toast({
            title: 'Failed to delete project',
            description: error.response?.data?.error || 'Unknown error',
            variant: 'destructive'
        });
    }
});

docs.title: 1. ConversationHistory Component
docs.text:
Purpose: Show iterative prompting history

Features: - Chronological message list - User/AI message distinction - Version numbers linked - Timestamp display - Click to load version - Scroll to latest - Search/filter

UI: 

<div className="space-y-3 max-h-96 overflow-y-auto">
  {messages.map(msg => (
    <div key={msg.id} className={cn(
      "p-3 rounded-lg",
      msg.type === 'user' 
        ? "bg-primary/10 ml-4" 
        : "bg-muted mr-4"
    )}>
      <div className="flex items-center gap-2 mb-1">
        {msg.type === 'user' ? <User /> : <Bot />}
        <span className="text-xs text-muted-foreground">
          {msg.timestamp.toLocaleTimeString()}
        </span>
        {msg.versionNumber && (
          <Badge variant="outline">v{msg.versionNumber}</Badge>
        )}
      </div>
      <p className="text-sm">{msg.content}</p>
    </div>
  ))}
</div>

docs.title: 2. PersistentPromptPanel Component
docs.text:
Purpose: Always-visible prompt interface

Features: - Fixed at bottom or side - Quick template access - Suggestion chips - Model selector - Character count - Submit button - Loading state

UI: 

<Card className="sticky bottom-4">
  <CardContent className="pt-6 space-y-3">
    {/* Suggestions */}
    <div className="flex gap-2 flex-wrap">
      {suggestions.map(s => (
        <Button
          key={s}
          variant="outline"
          size="sm"
          onClick={() => setPrompt(s)}
        >
          {s}
        </Button>
      ))}
    </div>

    {/* Prompt Input */}
    <Textarea
      value={prompt}
      onChange={(e) => setPrompt(e.target.value)}
      placeholder="Describe changes or improvements..."
      rows={3}
    />

    {/* Actions */}
    <div className="flex gap-2">
      <Select value={model} onValueChange={setModel}>
        {/* Model options */}
      </Select>
      <Button onClick={onSubmit} className="flex-1">
        <Sparkles className="mr-2 h-4 w-4" />
        {isGenerating ? 'Generating...' : 'Generate'}
      </Button>
    </div>
  </CardContent>
</Card>

docs.text:
Purpose: Context-aware improvement suggestions

Features: - Analyzes current code - Shows relevant suggestions - One-click apply - Categories (UI, Performance, Accessibility) - Dismissible - Refresh suggestions

<Card>
  <CardHeader>
    <CardTitle className="text-sm flex items-center gap-2">
      <Lightbulb className="h-4 w-4" />
      Suggested Improvements
    </CardTitle>
  </CardHeader>
  <CardContent className="space-y-2">
    {suggestions.map(s => (
      <Button
        key={s.id}
        variant="outline"
        size="sm"
        className="w-full justify-start"
        onClick={() => applySuggestion(s)}
      >
        <span className="mr-2">{s.icon}</span>
        {s.text}
      </Button>
    ))}
  </CardContent>
</Card>

docs.title: Iterative Enhancement Flow
docs.text:
1. User creates initial prototype
   "Create a dashboard with charts"
   ↓
2. AI generates Dashboard v1
   Preview shows on right
   ↓
3. User sees suggestions:
   - Add dark mode
   - Make responsive
   - Add animations
   ↓
4. User clicks "Add dark mode"
   OR types custom prompt
   ↓
5. AI enhances to v2
   Preview updates live
   Conversation shows history
   ↓
6. User continues iterating
   Until satisfied
   ↓
7. User exports or shares

docs.title: 1. Feature Discoverability (Critical)
docs.text:
Issue: Advanced features are hidden in tabs and not immediately visible - Users may not know about Tests, Diff, Split view, Comments, Collaboration - No onboarding or feature highlights - No tooltips or help text

Recommendation: - Add feature cards/badges showing available capabilities - Include quick tour or feature highlights - Add contextual help icons with tooltips

docs.title: 2. Generation Panel (High Priority)
docs.text:
Issue: Basic form without guidance or examples - No prompt suggestions or templates - No character count or validation feedback - No preview of what will be generated - Model selection lacks detailed information

Recommendation: - Add prompt templates/examples - Show character count and limits - Add "What can I build?" help section - Enhanced model selector with performance metrics

docs.title: 3. Prototype List (Medium Priority)
docs.text:
Issue: Simple list without rich metadata - No preview thumbnails - No quick actions (delete, duplicate, share) - No search or filter - No sorting options

Recommendation: - Add thumbnail previews - Include quick action buttons - Add search and filter capabilities - Show usage stats (tokens, generation time)

docs.title: 4. Preview Panel (High Priority)
docs.text:
Issue: Features are in tabs but not well explained - No indication of what each tab does - No keyboard shortcuts shown - No quick access to common actions

Recommendation: - Add tab descriptions - Show keyboard shortcuts - Add quick action toolbar - Include feature badges (NEW, BETA)

docs.title: 5. Collaboration Features (Medium Priority)
docs.text:
Issue: Collaboration status is minimal - No clear indication of who's viewing - No cursor tracking - No presence indicators

Recommendation: - Add collaborator avatars - Show active cursors - Add presence indicators - Include chat/comments prominently

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Node.js v20.15.0 or higher
  • PostgreSQL database
  • Ollama running locally

docs.title: Step 1: Install Dependencies
docs.text:
cd /Users/teejay/dev/chat-companion
npm install

docs.title: Step 2: Generate Encryption Key
docs.text: Choose one method:

docs.title: Option A: Using OpenSSL (Recommended)
docs.text: openssl rand -base64 32

docs.title: Option B: Using Node.js
docs.text: node -e "console.log(require('crypto').randomBytes(32).toString('base64'))"

docs.title: Option C: Using Python
docs.text: python3 -c "import secrets; print(secrets.token_urlsafe(32))"

docs.title: Step 3: Update Environment Variables
docs.text:
Add to your .env file:

# CRITICAL: Required for GitHub token encryption
ENCRYPTION_KEY=<paste-your-generated-key-here>

# Verify these existing variables:
DATABASE_URL=postgresql://user:password@localhost:5432/localbridge

docs.title: Option B: Migration Script (Large Dataset)
docs.text:
Create migrate-encrypt-tokens.ts:

import { db } from './server/db/index.js';
import { projects } from './server/db/schema.js';
import { encrypt } from './server/lib/crypto.js';
import { eq, isNotNull } from 'drizzle-orm';

async function migrateTokens() {
    console.log('Starting token encryption migration...');

    // Get all projects with tokens
    const projectsWithTokens = await db.query.projects.findMany({
        where: isNotNull(projects.githubToken)
    });

    console.log(`Found ${projectsWithTokens.length} projects with tokens`);

    for (const project of projectsWithTokens) {
        try {
            // Try to decrypt - if it fails, it's plaintext
            try {
                decrypt(project.githubToken!);
                console.log(`✅ Project ${project.id} already encrypted`);
                continue;
            } catch {
                // Token is plaintext, encrypt it
                const encrypted = encrypt(project.githubToken!);

                await db.update(projects)
                    .set({ githubToken: encrypted })
                    .where(eq(projects.id, project.id));

                console.log(`✅ Encrypted token for project ${project.id}`);
            }
        } catch (error) {
            console.error(`❌ Failed to encrypt project ${project.id}:`, error);
        }
    }

    console.log('Migration complete!');
}

migrateTokens().catch(console.error);

Run migration: 

npx tsx migrate-encrypt-tokens.ts

docs.text:
// Conversation state
const [conversationHistory, setConversationHistory] = useState<ConversationMessage[]>([]);

// Current prototype state
const [currentCode, setCurrentCode] = useState('');
const [currentVersion, setCurrentVersion] = useState(1);

// Generation state
const [isGenerating, setIsGenerating] = useState(false);
const [prompt, setPrompt] = useState('');

// Add message to conversation
const addMessage = (type: 'user' | 'ai', content: string, versionNumber?: number) => {
  setConversationHistory(prev => [...prev, {
    id: Date.now().toString(),
    type,
    content,
    timestamp: new Date(),
    versionNumber,
    status: 'success'
  }]);
};

// Handle generation
const handleGenerate = async () => {
  // Add user message
  addMessage('user', prompt);

  setIsGenerating(true);

  try {
    // Generate code
    const result = await generatePrototype(prompt);

    // Add AI message
    addMessage('ai', `Generated version ${result.version}`, result.version);

    // Update current code
    setCurrentCode(result.code);
    setCurrentVersion(result.version);
  } catch (error) {
    // Handle error
  } finally {
    setIsGenerating(false);
  }
};

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Status: ✅ PRODUCTION READY (v2.5)

The Cyber Forensics Architect is a production-ready AI-powered tool designed to help security professionals and digital forensics investigators design and implement custom forensic analysis tools. It generates production-quality code with strict adherence to ISO 27037 guidelines for digital evidence handling.

docs.title: Key Capabilities
docs.text:
• AI-Powered Tool Design: Generate forensic tools using advanced AI models (Llama 3.1, DeepSeek Coder, Qwen 2.5)
  • Evidence Chain-of-Custody: Complete audit trail with ISO 27037 compliance and SHA-256 verification
  • Multi-Format Export: Export designs as Markdown (.md), JSON (.json), or HTML (.html) with full metadata
  • Configuration Management: Save, load, search, and reuse tool configurations for efficient workflows
  • Forensic Templates: Pre-built templates for Network, Memory, and Log analysis scenarios
  • Multi-Language Support: Generate tools in Rust, Go, C++, or Python
  • Stealth Mode: Optional detection evasion techniques for sensitive operations
  • Forensic Integrity: Read-only operations with cryptographic verification

docs.title: Production Features (v2.5)
docs.text:
• ✅ Evidence chain-of-custody tracking with case metadata
  • ✅ SHA-256 cryptographic hash verification
  • ✅ Export to Markdown, JSON, and HTML formats
  • ✅ Save/load configuration management
  • ✅ Search and filter saved configurations
  • ✅ Enhanced forensic templates (12+ templates)
  • ✅ Real-time AI streaming generation
  • ✅ Comprehensive audit logging

1. Navigate to Cyber Forensics
  2. Go to Enterprise Solutions Hub from the main menu

  3. Select "Cyber Forensics" tab (marked with Production badge)

  4. Choose Your Domain

  5. Network: Packet analysis, protocol reassembly, TLS fingerprinting
  6. Memory: Process analysis, memory dumps, rootkit detection

  7. Logs: Event log analysis, threat hunting, malware detection

  8. Configure Your Tool

  9. Select implementation language (Rust, Go, C++, Python)
  10. Load a template or define custom forensic task
  11. Enter case metadata (Case ID, Investigator name)

  12. Enable Stealth Mode if needed

  13. Generate Design

  14. Click "Generate Tool Design"
  15. Review the AI-generated architecture
  16. Verify evidence with SHA-256 hash
  17. Export (Markdown/JSON/HTML) or save configuration

  • Audit Log: Automatic logging of all actions and modifications
  • ISO 27037 Compliance: Follows international standards for digital evidence

docs.title: Programmatic Access
docs.text: The Cyber Forensics Architect can be integrated into automated workflows:

docs.title: Endpoint
docs.text: POST /api/prototype/generate-stream

docs.title: Headers
docs.text:
{
  "Content-Type": "application/json",
  "Authorization": "Bearer YOUR_TOKEN"
}

docs.title: Request Body
docs.text:
{
  "prompt": "Your forensic tool requirements",
  "name": "Forensics-network-1234567890",
  "model": "llama3.1:latest",
  "projectId": "forensics-hub"
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
Server-Sent Events (SSE) stream with chunks: 

data: {"chunk": "Generated code chunk..."}
data: {"chunk": "More code..."}

docs.title: Example Integration (Node.js)
docs.text:
const fetch = require('node-fetch');

async function generateForensicTool(task, category, language) {
  const prompt = constructPrompt(task, category, language);

  const response = await fetch('http://localhost:3001/api/prototype/generate-stream', {
    method: 'POST',
    headers: {
      'Content-Type': 'application/json',
      'Authorization': `Bearer ${process.env.AUTH_TOKEN}`
    },
    body: JSON.stringify({
      prompt,
      name: `Forensics-${category}-${Date.now()}`,
      model: 'llama3.1:latest',
      projectId: 'forensics-hub'
    })
  });

  // Handle SSE stream
  const reader = response.body.getReader();
  const decoder = new TextDecoder();
  let output = '';

  while (true) {
    const { done, value } = await reader.read();
    if (done) break;

    const chunk = decoder.decode(value);
    const lines = chunk.split('\n');

    for (const line of lines) {
      if (line.startsWith('data: ')) {
        const data = JSON.parse(line.slice(6));
        output += data.chunk;
      }
    }
  }

  return output;
}

docs.title: Python Integration
docs.text:
import requests
import json

def generate_forensic_tool(task, category, language):
    prompt = construct_prompt(task, category, language)

    response = requests.post(
        'http://localhost:3001/api/prototype/generate-stream',
        headers={
            'Content-Type': 'application/json',
            'Authorization': f'Bearer {os.getenv("AUTH_TOKEN")}'
        },
        json={
            'prompt': prompt,
            'name': f'Forensics-{category}-{int(time.time())}',
            'model': 'llama3.1:latest',
            'projectId': 'forensics-hub'
        },
        stream=True
    )

    output = ''
    for line in response.iter_lines():
        if line.startswith(b'data: '):
            data = json.loads(line[6:])
            output += data.get('chunk', '')

    return output

docs.title: Reporting a Vulnerability
docs.text: We take the security of LocalBridge seriously. If you believe you have found a security vulnerability, please report it to us as described below.

docs.title: Please DO NOT:
docs.text:
• Open a public GitHub issue for security vulnerabilities
  • Disclose the vulnerability publicly before it has been addressed

docs.title: Please DO:
docs.text:
1. Email us directly at: security@your-domain.com (replace with your email)
  2. Include the following information:
  3. Type of vulnerability
  4. Full paths of source file(s) related to the vulnerability
  5. Location of the affected source code (tag/branch/commit or direct URL)
  6. Step-by-step instructions to reproduce the issue
  7. Proof-of-concept or exploit code (if possible)
  8. Impact of the vulnerability

docs.title: What to expect:
docs.text:
• Acknowledgment: We will acknowledge receipt of your vulnerability report within 48 hours
  • Updates: We will send you regular updates about our progress
  • Disclosure: Once the vulnerability is fixed, we will publicly disclose it (with your permission to credit you)
